description: Lenart Kova, under mounting pressure and after late-night calls with Directorate officials, agrees to provide technical support for citywide security clampdown, including biometric checkpoints and enhanced surveillance.

Directorate, with Kova’s assistance, announces emergency measures: biometric checkpoints, movement restrictions, and intensified monitoring across districts linked to recent unrest and ghost testimonies. Public debate and reform discussions are swiftly silenced.
Oksana Lintz is formally sidelined, barred from making public statements or accessing BCI administrator controls. Kova is placed in charge of technical compliance for new Directorate protocols.

Ghost representatives, now forced underground, release a statement urging peaceful resistance and warning of new secret detentions as crackdowns increase. Reports of silent erasures begin circulating in activist networks.

Widespread frustration erupts as BCI enforcement causes access delays and unexpected privilege losses, especially targeting protesters and those allied with ghost citizens. Underground networks organize renewed opposition despite intensified surveillance.
